intro: Linkia brachystylis, commonly known as the dwarf linkia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and fragrant, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
